messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 886
messages.msgSnippet: ... history or not when her exposure to the subject is limited to what they presented in public school? I hated history until I read the Little House Series to
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>I feel like I'm cheating but how can she know if she's interested in
history or not when her exposure to the subject is limited to what they
presented in public school?

I hated history until I read the Little House Series to my girls.
Thought it was sooo boring. Now I know that history is just people's
stories. OK, not "just" stories, but far more than a series of wars and
dates. Unfortunately, school has a way of turning kids off of
"subjects".

Mary Ellen
Nobody had a watch, so they ate lunch when they got hungry.
